ingredients.ingredient: 2 medium sweet onions (such as Vidalia®), quartered
4 serrano chiles, split in 1/2 lengthwise and seeds and membranes removed
2 bunches fresh thyme, tied with string
1 ⅔ cups seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay®), or more to taste
6 teaspoons kosher salt, or more to taste
3 pounds medium red potatoes, cut in 1/2
5 (13 ounce) packages smoked kielbasa sausage, cut into 2-inch pieces
4 pounds jumbo shrimp, deveined, tail on
2 ½ pounds Alaskan king crab legs

cookingTips: Add ingredients in stages based on cooking time: potatoes first, then sausage, then corn, finishing with seafood
The broth should have intense Old Bay flavor; season generously
Clams and shrimp cook quickly; monitor to avoid overcooking
enrichment.coachingPrompt: This classic seafood boil requires timing different ingredients to finish simultaneously. Help the cook understand why adding ingredients sequentially ensures everything reaches doneness together.
